properties.name: Watch & Act
properties.action: Monitor Conditions As They Are Changing
properties.location: Mona Park, Mooralla, Woohlpooer, Cavendish, Rocklands
properties.webBody:
This Watch and Act message is being issued for Cavendish, Mona Park, Mooralla, Rocklands, Woohlpooer.
  • The bushfire in the Grampians National Park (Bullawin) is not yet under control.
  • The bushfire is travelling in a North-Westerly direction.
  • Crews continue to actively work on managing hazardous trees, black out the edge of the fire and extinguish hot spots. 
Community Newsletter
For further information, please access the Community Newsletter here.

The situation can change at any time. You must monitor conditions and be ready to act.
What you should do: 
  • Monitor changes to the situation. Increased wind speed, change in wind direction, smoke or poor visibility can indicate the situation is changing. 
  • Enact your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes. 
  • If you have time, check your neighbours to see if they are monitoring conditions. 
  • Protect yourself and your family.

Leave if the situation changes or you feel unsafe. 
Remember to:
  • Take your pets, medications, mobile phone and charger. 
  • Many people have died trying to leave at the last minute during fires. 
  • Travel to the home of family or friends that are away from the warning area.
Impacts in your area:
  • Bushfires can spread quickly and are extremely dangerous. 
  • The Henty Highway is closed between Horsham and Cavendish.
  • Check the VicTraffic website (www.traffic.transport.vic.gov.au) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 05/02/2025 06:10 am or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226 
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires) 
  • ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • For information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.   
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service for assistance and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text: WATCH & ACT - BUSHFIRE - Monitor Conditions As They Are Changing Incident Location: Grampians National Park - Victoria Range (Bullawin) Issue Date: Tuesday 04 February 2025, 09:27 pm Next Update: Wednesday 05 February 2025, 06:10 am More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/36427/moreinfo This Watch and Act message is being issued for Cavendish, Mona Park, Mooralla, Rocklands, Woohlpooer. - The bushfire in the Grampians National Park (Bullawin) is not yet under control. - The bushfire is travelling in a North-Westerly direction. - Crews continue to actively work on managing hazardous trees, black out the edge of the fire and extinguish hot spots. Community Newsletter For further information, please access the Community Newsletter here. The situation can change at any time. You must monitor conditions and be ready to act.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Bellfield, Bellfield Settlement, Halls Gap.
  • There is a bushfire at Grampians National Park - Victoria Range (Bullawin) that is not yet under control.
  • There is active fire within the Victoria Valley area in Grampians National Park.
  • Increased fire activity in the Victoria Valley is producing large quantities of smoke.
  • Ash fall may be seen in the area
  • There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and plan for what you will do if the situation changes. 
What you should do: 
  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
  • Review your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Firefighters are responding to this fire.
  • Check the VicTraffic website (www.traffic.transport.vic.gov.au) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 05/02/2025 10:10 am or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

Issue Date: Tuesday 04 February 2025, 09:36 pm
Next Update: Wednesday 05 February 2025, 10:10 am

This Advice message is being issued for Bellfield, Bellfield Settlement, Halls Gap.
- There is a bushfire at Grampians National Park - Victoria Range (Bullawin) that is not yet under control.
- There is active fire within the Victoria Valley area in Grampians National Park.
- Increased fire activity in the Victoria Valley is producing large quantities of smoke.
- Ash fall may be seen in the area


- There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and plan for what you will do if the situation changes.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Rubicon, Thornton.
  • There is a bushfire at Middle Range, Rubicon that is under control.
  • Smoke from the bushfire is travelling from Middle Range, Rubicon in a north-westerly direction towards Thornton.
  • This Advice replaces the Advice issued at 09:15 PM Tuesday 4th February.
There is currently no threat to communities, but you should continue to stay informed and monitor conditions.
What you should do: 
  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
Impacts in your area: 
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 05/02/2025 10:00 am or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

This Watch and Act message is being issued for Brimpaen, Cherrypool, Glenisla, Glenisla Crossing, Grampians, Hynes, Mooralla, Rocklands, Telangatuk East, Wartook, Zumsteins.

  •  The bushfire is travelling in a north-westerly direction.

The situation can change at any time. You must monitor conditions and be ready to act.

Leave if the situation changes or you feel unsafe.

properties.name: Watch & Act
properties.location: Big Cord, Mirranatwa, Strachans, Victoria Point, Victoria Valley
properties.webBody:
This Watch and Act message is being issued for Big Cord, Mirranatwa, Strachans, Victoria Point, Victoria Valley. 
  • The a bushfire that started at Grampians National Park - Victoria Range (Bullawin) is not yet under control. 
  • The spread of the bushfire has slowed for now, but the situation can change at any time. You must monitor conditions and be ready to act.
  • Fire crews continue to work on building containment line and supressing fire activity.
  • Smoke will be visible in the area and active firefighting operations will be occurring.
The threat is reduced, but the situation can change at any time. You must monitor conditions and be ready to act.
What you should do:  
  • Monitor changes to the situation. Increased wind speed, change in wind direction, smoke or poor visibility can indicate the situation is changing. 
  • Enact your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes. 
  • If you have time, check your neighbours to see if they are monitoring conditions. 
  • Protect yourself and your family. 
Leave if the situation changes or you feel unsafe. Remember to: 
  • Take your pets, medications, mobile phone and charger. 
  • Many people have died trying to leave at the last minute during fires. 
Impacts in your area: 
  • The Henty Highway is closed between Horsham & Cavendish. 
  • Check the VicTraffic website (www.traffic.transport.vic.gov.au) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
  • Community Newsletter - For further information please access the Community Newsletter here. 
Grampians National Park
  • The Southern Grampians (Gariwerd) National Park is closed due to the current weather conditions, which are causing unpredictable fire activity.
  • This includes Mt Abrupt, Mt Sturgeon and Piccaninny walking tracks.
  • The Grampians Tourist Road from Dunkeld to Halls Gap is currently open.
Smoke:
  • Your nose is an excellent smoke detector. If you can smell smoke, take the necessary precautions to protect your health. You can self-assess the air quality near you using https://www.epa.vic.gov.au/for-community/environmental-information/air-quality/smoke/smoke-your-health.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.   

The next update is expected by 05/02/2025 07:00 am or as the situation changes.   

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226 
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires) 
  • ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.   
Accessibility: 
  • The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. For information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.   
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service for assistance and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
The Threat is Reduced following the bushfire at Little Desert National Park. 
  • This Advice message replaces the Advice issued at 3.00pm on Monday 3 February.
  • The spread of the fire has been slowed, crews continue to work on building containment line and supressing fire activity. 
Community Meeting
Members of the community are invited to attend the Goroke Community Meeting held 6pm Tuesday 4 February at  Goroke & District Memorial Hall -  27 Main St, Goroke VIC 3412.
People located within the area are now able to resume normal activities.

Whilst the threat is reduced, people are advised to remain vigilant and monitor conditions as the situation can change quickly.
Impacts in your area:
  • Emergency services will remain in the area. 
  • The following roads is still closed: Kaniva-Edenhope Road.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.  

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226 
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires) 
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility: 
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. 
  • To access this information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.   
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service for assistance and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

  • There is a bushfire at Little Desert National Park that is not yet under control. 
  • Firefighters have stopped the spread of fire and will remain on scene throughout the evening.
  • Smoke may be visible in the area.
The situation can change at any time. You must monitor conditions and be ready to act.
What you should do: 
  • Monitor changes to the situation. Increased wind speed, change in wind direction, smoke or poor visibility can indicate the situation is changing. 
  • Enact your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes. 
  • If you have time, check your neighbours to see if they are monitoring conditions. 
  • Protect yourself and your family.
Leave if the situation changes or you feel unsafe. 
Remember to:
  • Take your pets, medications, mobile phone and charger. 
  • Many people have died trying to leave at the last minute during fires. 
  • Travel to the home of family or friends that are away from the warning area.
Impacts in your area:
  • Bushfires can spread quickly and are extremely dangerous.
  • Check the VicTraffic website (www.traffic.transport.vic.gov.au) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 05/02/2025 07:50 am or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed:

properties.name: Watch & Act
properties.action: Monitor Conditions As They Are Changing
properties.webBody:
This Watch and Act message is being issued for Goroke, Lawloit, Miram South, Peronne.
  • There is a bushfire at Goroke, Lawloit, Miram South, Peronne that is not yet under control.
  • Firefighters have stopped the spread of fire and will remain on scene throughout the evening.
  • Smoke will be visible in the area.
The situation can change at any time. You must monitor conditions and be ready to act.
What you should do: 
  • Monitor changes to the situation. Increased wind speed, change in wind direction, smoke or poor visibility can indicate the situation is changing. 
  • Enact your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes. 
  • If you have time, check your neighbours to see if they are monitoring conditions. 
  • Protect yourself and your family.
Leave if the situation changes or you feel unsafe. 
Remember to:
  • Take your pets, medications, mobile phone and charger. 
  • Many people have died trying to leave at the last minute during fires. 

Impacts in your area:
  • The Kaniva-Edenhope Road between Western Hwy and Natimuk-Frances Rd is closed.
  • Check the VicTraffic website (www.traffic.transport.vic.gov.au) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
  • Bushfires can spread quickly and are extremely dangerous.
Smoke:
  • Your nose is an excellent smoke detector. If you can smell smoke, take the necessary precautions to protect your health. You can self-assess the air quality near you using https://www.epa.vic.gov.au/for-community/environmental-information/air-quality/smoke/smoke-your-health.Take action to reduce your exposure to smoke and protect your health: Everyone should minimise the time spent in smoky conditions whenever practical to do so.
  • People over 65 years, children 14 years and younger, pregnant women and those with existing heart or lung conditions, should reduce prolonged or heavy physical activity. Where possible (and not under direct threat from fires), also limit the time spent outdoors and when indoors, close windows and doors. If there is a break in smoky conditions, open the windows and air out your home.
  • Anyone with a heart or lung condition should take their medication as prescribed. People with asthma should follow their personal asthma action plan, continue to take preventer medication as prescribed and keep reliever medication on hand.
  • If you or anyone in your care is worried about symptoms, seek medical advice or call Nurse on Call on 1300 60 60 24.Anyone experiencing difficulty breathing or tightness in the chest should seek urgent medical assistance and call Triple Zero (000).
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 05/02/2025 07:40 am or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226 
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires) 
  • ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • For information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.   
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service for assistance and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice
properties.location: Bellfield, Bellfield Settlement, Bornes Hill, Borough Huts, Flat Rock Crossing, Jimmy Creek, Mafeking, Dunkeld, Glenisla, Glenthompson, Grampians, Halls Gap, Mirranatwa, Moyston, Pomonal, Victoria Valley, Zumsteins
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Bellfield, Bellfield Settlement, Bornes Hill, Borough Huts, Dunkeld, Flat Rock Crossing, Glenisla, Glenthompson, Grampians, Halls Gap, Jimmy Creek, Mafeking, Mirranatwa, Moyston, Pomonal, Victoria Valley, Zumsteins
  • The status of the bushfire on the eastern side of the Grampians National Park between Bellfield and Bornes Hill is now Under Control.
  • This Advice replaces the Advice issued on 28 January.
  • Firefighters and heavy machinery continue to monitor hotspots, treat hazardous trees, clear tracks and rehabilitate control lines.
  • Small areas of smoke within the containment area may be visible.
There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and plan for what you will do if the situation changes. 
What you should do: 
  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
  • Drive with caution. Obey road closure signs.  
  • Visitors are reminded to be cautious of ongoing risks and changes to the environment which may include fallen or damaged trees, smoke and injured wildlife.
  • If you see impacted wildlife - call 1300 356 682. 
Recovery and resilience
If you have been or may be impacted by bushfire, it is understandable if you are feeling concerned and experiencing a mix of strong mental, emotional or physical reactions right now. For emergency relief information during major incidents, call the VicEmergency hotline on 1800 226 226 or visit www.emergency.vic.gov.au/relief
Impacts in your area: 
  • Drivers may encounter fire crews and heavy machinery on roads and tracks. Please take care and drive safely. 
  • Many roads within the fire affected area remain closed. Check the VicTaffic website or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
Grampians National Park
  • The Southern Grampians (Gariwerd) National Park is closed due to the current weather conditions, which are causing unpredictable fire activity.
  • This includes Mt Abrupt, Mt Sturgeon and Piccaninny walking tracks.
  • The Grampians Tourist Road from Dunkeld to Halls Gap is currently open.
  • For details on access to the park, visit the Parks Vic website or call in to Brambuk - The National Park and Cultural Centre in Halls Gap.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 11/02/2025 02:40 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text:
ADVICE - BUSHFIRE - Stay Informed
Incident Location: Grampians National Park
Issue Date: Tuesday 04 February 2025, 03:24 pm
Next Update: Tuesday 11 February 2025, 02:40 pm

More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/36384/moreinfo

This Advice message is being issued for Bellfield, Bellfield Settlement, Bornes Hill, Borough Huts, Dunkeld, Flat Rock Crossing, Glenisla, Glenthompson, Grampians, Halls Gap, Jimmy Creek, Mafeking, Mirranatwa, Moyston, Pomonal, Victoria Valley, Zumsteins
- The status of the bushfire on the eastern side of the Grampians National Park between Bellfield and Bornes Hill is now Under Control.
- This Advice replaces the Advice issued on 28 January.
- Firefighters and heavy machinery continue to monitor hotspots, treat hazardous trees, clear tracks and rehabilitate control lines. 
- Small areas of smoke within the containment area may be visible.


There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and plan for what you will do if the situation changes.

properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Aire Valley, Apollo Bay, Cape Horn, Cape Otway, Glenaire, Hordern Vale, Killala.
  • There is a bushfire at Hordern Vale - Binns Road that is not yet under control.
  • Firefighters have been able to slow the spread of fire for now, but the situation can change at any time.
  • This Advice replaces the Watch and Act message issued at 3:28 PM.
There is currently no threat to communities, but you should continue to stay informed and monitor conditions.
What you should do: 
  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
  • Review your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Binns Road is closed.
  • Firefighters are patrolling this fire.
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 05/02/2025 10:00 am or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app

  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.

properties.name: Advice
properties.location: Cooack, Dimboola, Little Desert, Winiam East, Duchembegarra, Gerang Gerung, Goroke, Grass Flat, Kiata, Nhill, Nurcoung, Pimpinio, Wail
properties.webBody:
The Threat is Reduced following the bushfire at Little Desert National Park. 
  • This Advice message replaces the advice message issued at 2.29pm Monday 3 February 2025.
  • The bushfire in the Little Desert National Park is now contained.
  • Fire crews are actively working on this fire, managing hazardous trees, blacking out hot spots and consolidating containment lines.
  • Surrounding communities may continue to see smoke from this fire.
People located within the area are now able to resume normal activities.
Impacts in your area:
  • Emergency services will still be active at this fire. 
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
  • Check the VicTraffic website (www.traffic.transport.vic.gov.au) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.

Community Meeting
Members of the community are invited to attend the Goroke Community Meeting held 6pm Tuesday 4 February at  Goroke & District Memorial Hall -  27 Main St, Goroke VIC 3412.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.  

This will be the final message issued for this fire. 

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226 
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires) 
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility: 
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. 
  • To access this information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.   
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service for assistance and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text:
ADVICE - BUSHFIRE - Threat Is Reduced
Incident Location: Little Desert National Park
Issue Date: Monday 03 February 2025, 07:24 pm
Next Update: Wednesday 12 February 2025, 12:00 am

More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/36351/moreinfo

The Threat is Reduced following the bushfire at Little Desert National Park. 
- This Advice message replaces the advice message issued at 2.29pm Monday 3 February 2025. 
- The bushfire in the Little Desert National Park is now contained. 
- Fire crews are actively working on this fire, managing hazardous trees, blacking out hot spots and consolidating containment lines.
- Surrounding communities may continue to see smoke from this fire.


People located within the area are now able to resume normal activities.

properties.name: Watch & Act
properties.action: Monitor Conditions As They Are Changing
properties.webBody:
This Watch and Act message is being issued for Kaniva, Miram, Yanipy.
  • There is a bushfire at in the Little Desert National Park that is not yet under control. 
  • Firefighters have stopped the spread of fire and will remain on scene throughout the evening.
  • Smoke may be visible in the area.

The situation can change at any time. You must monitor conditions and be ready to act.
What you should do: 
  • Monitor changes to the situation. Increased wind speed, change in wind direction, smoke or poor visibility can indicate the situation is changing. 
  • Enact your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes. 
  • If you have time, check your neighbours to see if they are monitoring conditions. 
  • Protect yourself and your family.
Leave if the situation changes or you feel unsafe. 
Remember to:
  • Take your pets, medications, mobile phone and charger. 
  • Many people have died trying to leave at the last minute during fires. 
  • Travel to the home of family or friends that are away from the warning area.
Impacts in your area:

  • Bushfires can spread quickly and are extremely dangerous.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 05/02/2025 07:10 am or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226 
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires) 
  • ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • For information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.   
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service for assistance and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Community Information
properties.webBody:
This Community Information is being issued for Swan Hill .
  • There is a haystack fire at Aerodrome Rd, Swan Hill. 
  • Haystack fires are not likely to spread into grassland but do generate a lot of smoke.
  • Firefighters are attending to this fire. 
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby roads and communities as firefighters pull apart the hay to extinguish the fire. 
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

Unless the situation changes, this will be the last message issued for this fire.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 

  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au.
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226.
  • VicEmergency app.
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. 
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to cal VicEmergency
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service for assistance and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
